storyTitle: As Scheduling Manager, I want to assign shift templates to employees to create schedules

testCases.title: Assign shift template to employee successfully
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduling Manager with valid credentials
At least one employee exists in the system
At least one shift template is configured and available
User has authorization to create employee schedules
Schedule creation page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed with options to select employees and shift templates

steps.action: Click on the employee selection dropdown and select a specific employee from the list
steps.expectedResult: Selected employee is highlighted and displayed in the employee field

steps.action: Click on the shift template dropdown and select a valid shift template
steps.expectedResult: Selected shift template is displayed with its details (start time, end time, duration)

steps.action: Select a valid start date and end date for the shift assignment using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Dates are populated in the date fields with no validation errors shown

steps.action: Review the assignment details to ensure employee, shift template, and dates are correct
steps.expectedResult: All assignment details are correctly displayed with no validation errors or warnings

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Save' button to save the schedule assignment
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is successfully saved to the database and a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Schedule assigned successfully')

steps.action: Verify the assigned schedule appears in the employee's schedule view
steps.expectedResult: The newly assigned shift is visible in the employee's schedule with correct dates and shift template details

postconditions: Employee schedule is saved in the EmployeeSchedules table
Schedule assignment is visible in the employee's schedule view
No overlapping shifts exist for the employee
System logs the schedule creation action with timestamp and manager details

testCases.title: Prevent overlapping shift assignments
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduling Manager
An employee already has a shift assigned for a specific date and time range
User has authorization to create employee schedules
Schedule creation page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed

steps.action: Select the employee who already has an existing shift assignment
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and displayed in the employee field

steps.action: Select a shift template that overlaps with the employee's existing shift (same date, overlapping time range)
steps.expectedResult: Shift template is selected and displayed

steps.action: Enter dates that create an overlap with the existing shift assignment
steps.expectedResult: Dates are entered in the date fields

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Save' button to attempt saving the overlapping schedule
steps.expectedResult: System displays a validation error message indicating shift overlap (e.g., 'Error: This shift overlaps with an existing assignment for this employee')

steps.action: Verify that the overlapping schedule is not saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: The overlapping shift does not appear in the employee's schedule and the original shift remains unchanged

steps.action: Attempt to close or dismiss the error message
steps.expectedResult: Error message is dismissed and user remains on the schedule creation form to make corrections

postconditions: No overlapping shift is saved in the EmployeeSchedules table
Original employee schedule remains intact
Validation error is logged in the system
User remains on the schedule creation page to correct the assignment

storyTitle: As Scheduling Manager, I want to validate employee schedules to ensure compliance with labor rules

testCases.title: Validate schedule against maximum working hours
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduling Manager
Labor rules are configured with maximum daily working hours limit (e.g., 12 hours per day)
At least one employee and shift template exist in the system
User has authorization to create and modify schedules

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and displayed

steps.action: Assign multiple shift templates or a single long shift that exceeds the maximum daily working hours limit
steps.expectedResult: Shifts are added to the schedule form showing total hours exceeding the limit

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Save' button to attempt saving the schedule
steps.expectedResult: System displays a validation error message (e.g., 'Error: Schedule exceeds maximum daily working hours of 12 hours') and prevents saving

steps.action: Verify that the schedule is not saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: The violating schedule does not appear in the employee's schedule view

steps.action: Adjust the schedule by removing or shortening shifts to comply with maximum working hours
steps.expectedResult: Total working hours are now within the allowed limit and no validation errors are displayed

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Save' button again
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully and a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Schedule saved successfully')

steps.action: Verify the compliant schedule appears in the employee's schedule view
steps.expectedResult: The adjusted schedule is visible with correct shift details and complies with labor rules

postconditions: Only compliant schedule is saved in the EmployeeSchedules table
No labor rule violations exist in the saved schedule
Validation attempt is logged in the system
Employee schedule reflects only the compliant assignments

testCases.title: Enforce minimum rest period between shifts
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduling Manager
Labor rules are configured with minimum rest period between shifts (e.g., 8 hours)
At least one employee exists in the system
User has authorization to create schedules

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and displayed

steps.action: Assign a first shift template with specific end time (e.g., ending at 10:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: First shift is added to the schedule

steps.action: Assign a second shift template that starts before the minimum rest period has elapsed (e.g., starting at 4:00 AM the next day, only 6 hours rest)
steps.expectedResult: Second shift is added to the schedule form

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Save' button to attempt saving the schedule
steps.expectedResult: System displays a warning or error message (e.g., 'Warning: Insufficient rest period between shifts. Minimum 8 hours required, only 6 hours provided')

steps.action: Verify that the system prevents saving or displays a clear warning requiring acknowledgment
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is either blocked from saving or requires manager acknowledgment of the violation before proceeding

postconditions: Schedule with insufficient rest period is not saved without proper acknowledgment
Validation warning/error is logged in the system
Manager is informed of the labor rule violation
Employee schedule remains compliant or violation is documented

testCases.title: Override validation with justification
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized Scheduling Manager with override permissions
Labor rules are configured and active
A schedule exists that violates one or more labor rules
Override functionality is enabled for authorized users

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page and create a schedule that violates labor rules (e.g., exceeds maximum hours or insufficient rest period)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is created with labor rule violations

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Save' button to attempt saving the violating schedule
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error or warning message with details of the violation

steps.action: Click on the 'Override' button or checkbox to indicate intention to override the validation
steps.expectedResult: System prompts for justification with a text input field or dialog box (e.g., 'Please provide justification for overriding this labor rule violation')

steps.action: Enter a valid business justification in the justification field (e.g., 'Emergency coverage required due to staff shortage')
steps.expectedResult: Justification text is entered and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Click the 'Confirm' or 'Save with Override' button to finalize the override
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully despite the labor rule violation, and a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Schedule saved with override')

steps.action: Verify that the override and justification are logged in the system audit trail
steps.expectedResult: System logs show the override action with timestamp, manager details, violation type, and justification text

steps.action: Navigate to the employee's schedule view to verify the schedule is saved
steps.expectedResult: The schedule with override is visible in the employee's schedule, potentially marked with an indicator showing it was saved with an override

postconditions: Schedule is saved in EmployeeSchedules table despite labor rule violation
Override action is logged with justification, timestamp, and manager identity
Schedule is marked or flagged as having an approved override
Audit trail contains complete override documentation for compliance review
